GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS

UNEV Pipeline, LLC's accidental release prevention programs and emergency planning and response programs help effectively manage the hazards posed by the facility's regulated substance to employees/contractors, the public, and the environment. The covered process is regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68 and the OSHA Process Safety Management Standard 29CFR 1910.119. The following accident prevention programs are in place at the Las Vegas Terminal:
1) Employee Participation,
2) Process Safety Information,
3) Process Hazard Analysis (PHA),
4) Standard Operating Procedures,
5) Operator Training,
6) Contractors,
7) Pre-startup Safety Review,
8) Mechanical Integrity,
9) Hazardous Work Authorization (Hot Work, etc.),
10) Management of Change,
11) Incident Investigation,
12) Emergency Procedures/Planning,
13) Compliance Audits, and
14) Trade Secrets.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no accidents within the past five (5) years as defined in 40 CFR Part 68.42.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Las Vegas Terminal Emergency Response Plan provides the essential planning and training for protecting employees, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. Contained within the Plan are written procedures that outline the actions to be taken for various types of emergencies that could occur in the facility. These emergencies may include: airborne releases of chemical substances, spills to the water or ground, fires, explosions, personnel medical emergencies.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

UNEV Pipeline, LLC is continually striving to make the Las Vegas Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors and community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable, and environmentally sound operations. The goal of the Las Vegas Terminal is to demonstrate

UNEV Pipeline, LLC
Las Vegas Terminal

RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The UNEV Pipeline, LLC - Las Vegas Terminal in North Las Vegas, NV is committed to providing a safe work environment for employees and to being a responsible corporate citizen. UNEV Pipeline, LLC believes that excellent performance in the areas of health, environment, safety and security goes hand-in-hand with operational excellence and financial success. In fulfilling this commitment, the Las Vegas Terminal will comply with regulatory requirements and provide and maintain a safe working environment using acceptable and proven business practices. All UNEV Pipeline, LLC employees will strive to identify and eliminate hazards which could result in injury and illness, damage to the environment, property damage, and security losses.

The Las Vegas Terminal is operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the community in which it operates. UNEV Pipeline, LLC promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This summary provides a brief overview of the risk management activities that we have designed and implemented.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

UNEV Pipeline, LLC - Las Vegas Terminal is a light products, bulk petroleum storage facility used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Las Vegas, Nevada. The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low-diesel fuel, and additives.  The Las Vegas Terminal complies with Process Safety Regulations in the covered process which encompasses the Butane unloading station, Butane storage vessel, valves, pump and associated piping.
